articles.author: Jonathan Weisman
articles.title: Spurred by the Supreme Court, a Nation Divides Along a Red-Blue Axis - The New York Times
articles.description: On abortion, climate change, guns and much more, two Americas — one liberal, one conservative — are moving in opposite directions.
articles.content: As the political divide between the states becomes more pronounced, what political scientists call sorting may accelerate. The conservative Illinois billionaire Kenneth Griffin announced last week th… [+1502 chars]

articles.title: WNBA's Brittney Griner goes on trial in Russian court - CTV News
articles.description: American basketball star Brittney Griner went on trial Friday, 4 1/2 months after her arrest on charges of possessing cannabis oil while returning to play for a Russian team, in a case that has unfolded amid tense relations between Moscow and Washington.
articles.content:

articles.author: Luke Andrews
articles.title: America's first monkeypox patient to come forward is an actor from Los Angeles - Daily Mail
articles.description: Matt Ford, who lives in Los Angeles, said he caught the virus after 'skin-to-skin contact' with another patient. He has spoken out to warn people the disease 'sucks' and to take it seriously.
articles.content: The first American monkeypox patient to go public with his battle against the tropical virus has slammed health officials for a 'lackluster' job of testing for the virus, which has left many cases un… [+8351 chars]
